Message.Issue: Add an implementation of GetObjectData to type 'DataSet1'.
Add an implementation of GetObjectData to type 'DataSet1.connectionDataTable'.

Message.TypeName: Do not dispose objects multiple times
Message.Issue: Object 'file' can be disposed more than once in method 'Form1.FTP(string, string)'. To avoid generating a System.ObjectDisposedException you should not call Dispose more than one time on an object.: Lines: 401
'Form2' contains field 'Form2.cel' that is of IDisposable type: 'DataGridViewCell'. Change the Dispose method on 'Form2' to call Dispose or Close on this field.

Message.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Message.Issue: The query string passed to 'SqlDataAdapter.SqlDataAdapter(string, SqlConnection)' in 'Form7.Form7_Load(object, EventArgs)' could contain the following variables 'CS$0$0005.ToString("MM/dd/yy")'. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

Rule.Name: Disposable fields should be disposed
Rule.Description: If a type that implements IDisposable owns fields that also implement IDisposable, the encapsulating type's Dispose() implementation should call Dispose() on each disposable field.
Rule.Resolution: {0} contains field {1} that is of IDisposable type: {2}. Change the Dispose method on {0} to call Dispose or Close on this field.

Rule.TypeName: Do not dispose objects multiple times
Rule.Name: Do not dispose objects multiple times
Rule.Description: A correctly implemented Dispose method can be called multiple times without throwing an exception. However, this is not guaranteed and to avoid generating a System.ObjectDisposedException you should not call Dispose more than one time on an object.
Rule.Resolution: Object {0} can be disposed more than once in method {1}. To avoid generating a System.ObjectDisposedException you should not call Dispose more than one time on an object.: Lines: 401

Rule.Name: Implement ISerializable correctly
Rule.Description: If a type is assignable to ISerializable, it should implement GetObjectData. For unsealed types, the GetObjectData method should be callable and overridable by derived types.
Rule.Resolution: Add an implementation of GetObjectData to type {0}.

Rule.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Rule.Name: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Rule.Description: A SQL command string built from user input is vulnerable to SQL injection attacks. Microsoft SQL Server and other database servers support stored procedures and parameterized SQL queries, which reduce the risk of injection attacks.
Rule.Resolution: The query string passed to {0} in {1} could contain the following variables {2}. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.
